Overrides.Override: 5% chance to Blind Enemies on Hit with Attacks
5% chance to Blind Enemies on Hit with Attacks

PathOfBuilding.Notes:
Note: 11 max proj if playing perfectly, 7x proj used here. Note 2: Synth implicit doesn't do anything, disregard it. Also I know I could have used veiled suffixes for helm/gloves for increased poison duration or increased attack speed, but I didnt want to increase my crafting costs (also its kind of overkill for dps).
~~CRAFTING~~
^xFFFF77WEAPON:^7 -Mini recombinator guide- This can be very, very time consuming and cost a lot of gold/dust. Also I might make small mistakes here so correct me if there's higher odds doing something else. Read: https://www.reddit.com/r/pathofexile/comments/1exyavx/325_updated_guide_to_recombinators/
Base - ilvl 82+ Spine Bow (show normal/magic/rare on filter, on FilterBlade its under "Highlight Specific Bases" and you create a new rule) You will need a looot of these as fodder. I kept a quad tab full of them.
Step 1) Alt spam - you want to hit 1 of the 6 T1 mods, if you hit another mod alongside it then annul it (unless its another t1 mod here).
Mods for Ideal Bow: ^x7070FF(1) Adds (28-38) to (549-638) Lightning Damage (Vapourising) (2) Adds (149-204) to (300-348) Cold Damage (Crystalising) (3) Adds (165-225) to (335-390) Fire Damage (Carbonising) (4) (17-19)% increased Attack Speed (of Acclaim) (5) (35-38)% increased Critical Strike Chance (of Incision) (6) (35-38)% to Global Critical Strike Multiplier (of Destruction)^7
^xE05030For the rest of the guide I will refer to these mods by their corresponding number on the left^7 (1 = Vapourising, 2 = Crystalising and so on...) with the following notation [1] -> Vapourising or [14] = Vapourising Spine Bow of Acclaim, [125] = Rare bow with flat lightning, cold and crit...
Make all of the bows you have magic then use the following regex: "vap|rbo|cry|acclaim|incis|dest" This should highlight any of the mods above. You'll notice I have T2 Cold on my bow... I got lazy/frustrated (you can just add whatever mod names to the regex).
I did these in batches of 20-30 bows. A quad tab lucky is 6 spine bows tall so it makes it easy to organize.
Step 2) Recombine 1 prefix and 1 suffix to get a magic bow that contains both. This might take several tries and is the step that eats the most bases.
eg. [1] + [4] => [14]
Step 3) Create another bow that is 1 prefix 1 suffix like in Step 2, but without containing the mods for the bow you have in Step 2.
eg. If I have [14] from Step 2, create some bow [25], [26], [35] or [36]
Step 4) Recombine these 2 bows. Any rare outcome here is very good. If it doesn't become rare go back to Step 3. Usually the resulting rare bow will have 3 mods.
eg. [14] + [25] => [124]
Step 5) Repeat from Step 1 or 2 depending on how many bases you have remaining. You are looking to create another rare bow that does not have overlapping mods with the bow you created in Step 4.
eg. [25] + [36] => [356]
Step 6) You should have 2 rare bows which together sum to all the mods on the bow (eg. [124] and [356] from above). We are going to leverage exclusive mods to increase odds
Craft 'Can have 3 Crafted Modifiers' on each bow.
On the bow that has 2 open prefixes craft (lower tiers are fine): - chaos pen and - minion attack/cast speed
On the bow that has 1 open prefix, 1 open suffix craft - chaos pen or minion attack/cast speed - +acc, +str/dex (there are other options here)
You can craft anything that comes from the pool of veiled mods but are lower tier.
Recombine and hope you hit a bow that is similar to mine. If you don't get all suffixes you're fine (ideally only missing multi). If not, you'll likely still have something workable for Step 5 and can repeat from there. If you are missing a suffix, craft the suffix (for the case of crit craft crit, +str/int and for multi craft the unique/rare one). If you are missing a prefix, restart from Step 5. It's fine if you have 4 perfect mods instead of 3. Multimodding to craft 1 single extra mod might seem weird but its fine.
^xFFFF77QUIVER:^7 Base: ilvl 86+ Primal Arrow Quiver - fractured crit multi
Step 1) Essence of Torment Spam til you hit T1 crit chance or +1 arrow Step 2) Make sure there is an open suffix and no other bad attack mods (annuls) Step 3) Cannot roll attack mods -> Slam. This can only hit damage with bow skills or life. If you get T2+ of either slam again. If you want to redo tiers just annul, recrafting Cannot roll attack mods when necessary. Step 4) Craft % attack speed
^xFFFF77HELMET:^7 Base: ilvl 85+ Dex-based helm, ideally with T1 fractured life
Step 1) Essence of Rage spam till T1 Suppress + open suffix Step 2) Suffixes cannot be changed + reforge chaos (hope for t2+ chaos res otherwise return to Step 1) Step 3) Craft +1 aoe gems/inc aoe + slam if fractured. If not then eldritch chaos reroll till life + open prefix.
^xFFFF77RINGS:^7 Base: Onslaught synth ring or fractured WED Amethyst Ring
Step 1) Essence of Scorn spam till you get good suffixes (T2+ res/acc/str) Step 2) Suffixes cannot be changed + reforge life -> hope for decent life Step 3) Craft -# mana or WED
^xFFFF77GLOVES:^7 Base: ilvl 85+ Dex based fractured attack speed gloves
Step 1) Fossil craft suffixes using Frigid + Sanctified + Hollow Fossils (I think this is fairly easy to hit T2+ res, I got it first try) Step 2) Eldritch chaos prefixes til you hit decent life. Step 3) If you have 2 open prefixes, slam once and hope for either hybrid life or flat elemental damage. Step 4) Craft dmg while leeching
^xFFFF77BODY ARMOUR^7: Pretty sure I just bought a dex base with life + ailement avoid/stun avoid then rerolled the suffixes because it was cheap and I was lazy. I just settled for this, there's other ways to craft better body armours. I mostly needed the eldritch implict (flask mod), many guides on how to do craft eldritch implicits online (including my previous guide). Alternative: Lightning Coil - Sapphire -> Topaz Flask
Other gems/gear are uniques or very cheap to buy at this stage in the league. If you have specific questions about how to craft them just leave a comment.
